application_type_full: Prior Approval: Change of use - retail/service/takeaway/etc to dwellinghouses
description: APPLICATION FOR PRIOR APPROVAL IN RESPECT OF THE THE PROPOSED PART CHANGE OF USE FROM BETTING SHOP (SUI GENERIS USE) TO RESIDENTIAL (C3 USE) TO PROVIDE 1 X STUDIO FLAT
decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - Approved Plans - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans: [2446_PR_201,
2446_PR_202 - Rev. A,
2446_PR_203 - Rev. A,
2446_PR_204 - Rev. A]

Condition : 2 - Matching Materials - The facing materials used in the development hereby permitted shall match those of the existing building in materials, style, colour, texture and, in the case of brickwork, bonding, coursing and pointing.

Condition : 3 - Notwithstanding the approval of the two prior approval applications on this site in relation to the part change of use from betting shop (sui generis use) to residential (C3 use) to provide 1 x studio flat, only one application shall be implemented. Prior to the commencement of any development, the applicant must notify the local planning authority in writing of the chosen application to be implemented. No development shall commence until written confirmation of the chosen application has been received from the local planning authority.

Condition : 4 - The development hereby approved shall not be occupied other than as a 1 bedroom 1 person unit.

REASON: To accord with terms of this prior approval submission and to ensure satisfactory standard of accommodation for future occupiers in accordance with Paragraph (9A) in Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2015 (as amended).

Condition : 5 - Cycle Parking  - Details to be Submitted - No development shall commence until details of secure cycle parking facilities for the occupants of, and visitors to, the development have been submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority.  The approved facilities shall be fully implemented and made available for use prior to the first occupation of the development and thereafter retained for use at all times.

Condition : 6 - No ground breaking works shall occur until: 
i) a preliminary risk-assessment is submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 
ii) a site-investigation has been conducted to consider the potential for contaminated-land and shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority. 
iii) a remediation method statement, described to make the site suitable for, intended use by removing 
unacceptable risks to sensitive receptors, and shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: In order to protect the health of future occupiers of the site and adjoining areas in accordance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy SI 10 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014

Condition : 7 - Prior to first occupation:

The remediation shall be completed and a verification report, produced on completion of the remediation, shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the local planning authority.

Reason: In order to protect the health of future occupiers of the site and adjoining areas in accordance with the following Development Plan policies for Merton: policy SI 10 of the London Plan 2021 and policy DM EP4 of Merton's Sites and Policies Plan 2014

Condition : 8 - It is a requirement of part M.2 that development under Class M is permitted subject to the condition that it must be completed within a period of 3 years starting with the prior approval date.

Reason: To accord with the legislation requirements.
